title: Student dies after drinking ‘toxic liquor’ in Kushtia
body: A COLLEGE student died and another fell seriously ill after reportedly drinking toxic liquor in Kushtia’s Daulatpur upazila on Friday night. The deceased was Hakim Ahmed, 21, son of Hasibul Islam, a resident of Chokghoga Purbopara area in the upazila. He was a student of Khalishakundi Degree College. The critically ill youth, Hazrat Uddin, 20, is the son of Bichar Uddin from the same village. Quoting local people, Daulatpur police station officer-in-charge Solaiman Sheikh said that Hakim fell sick after drinking alcohol with his friend in a litchi orchard on Friday evening, and both became ill shortly afterward. They were first taken to Daulatpur Hospital, but doctors referred them to Kushtia General Hospital as their condition worsened. Hakim died there while undergoing treatment at night, while Hazrat Uddin remained in critical condition at the hospital. An unnatural death case will be filed in connection with the incident, Solaiman added.
